intro: Anchusa pseudoochroleuca, commonly known as the lesser anchusa, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as coastal areas and limestone cliffs. Anchusa pseudoochroleuca is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
